cruise of some months along the East Coast of Australia 
and in Bass' Strait I have enjoyed peculiar opportunities 
for investigations of this kind, and that the study of 
other families hitherto but imperfectly known, has 
done much towards suggesting a clue in unravelling 
many complexities, at first sight, not very intelligible - 
[paragraph] 3 From the time of Peron & Lesueur downwards much has 
been said of the difficulties attending the examination 
of the <u>Medusae<\u> - I confess, I think that they have been 
greatly exaggerated - At least with a good microscope 
and a good light (with the ship tolerably steady) I 
have failed in procuring all the information I required 
The great matter is to <s>procure<\s> obtain a good <u>successive<\u> 
supply of specimens as the more delicate oceanic 
species are usually unfit for examination within 
a few hours after they are taken
